segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on her task, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just flowing right over the sink, and she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so quiet while they sneak those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really reaching for that jar, and I hope he doesn’t fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting patiently for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the woman because she’s going to be so shocked when she finally sees the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading all over the floor, and she’s still just drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse under the boy’s weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids do this often when she’s not looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just sad because no one is paying attention to what’s important.
segments.speaker: PAR
